turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Verziau of Gargantua.
turn.1: What is the Verziau of Gargantua?
turn.2: Verziau of Gargantua The verziau of Gargantua (or vierzeux of Gargantua), also known under the name of "Haute-Borne" is a menhir at Bois-lès-Pargny in France.
turn.3: What is notable about the monument?
turn.4: This is a monolith of hard sandstone 4 meters high and 35 1 m 50 wide.
turn.6: This stone chipped at the top, retains its base width to about half of its height, and tapers to its upper end, wide just over a meter.
turn.8: The menhir is located north of the town of Bois-lès-Pargny, and backed away a few meters from a small copse, near Sons-et-Ronchères.
turn.10: At the beginning of the 19th century, this menhir had a twin sister, which was destroyed to extract a large amount of sandstone to be paved.
turn.12: It is claimed that this menhir is based in a land length of sandstone equal to that shows above the ground, which would give a height of 9 meters.
